skill.name: daily-ai-news
skill.description: Aggregates and summarizes the latest AI news from multiple sources including AI news websites and web search. Provides concise news briefs with direct links to original articles. Activates when user asks for 'today's AI news', 'AI updates', 'latest AI developments', or mentions wanting a 'daily AI briefing'.
skill.summary: Aggregates and summarizes the latest AI news from multiple sources including AI news websites and we...

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation-based skill containing no executable code. All functionality is described as prompts and workflows for using web search and web reader tools. No file access, environment variables, network calls, or code execution capabilities. Appropriate for its news aggregation purpose.

content.value_statement: Finding reliable AI news across multiple sources takes time and effort. This skill automatically gathers news from major AI publications, filters for relevance and recency, and presents organized briefings with direct links to original articles.
actual_capabilities: Gather AI news from 5+ major publications using web search and web reader tools
Filter content to keep only recent announcements from the last 24-48 hours
Organize news into 5 categories: Major Announcements, Research, Industry, Tools, and Policy
Provide concise summaries with key points, impact analysis, and source links
Offer multiple output formats: Standard, Brief, Deep, Chronological, and By-Company
Allow customization by topic focus, depth level, time range, and format preference
limitations: Relies on external web tools being available and accessible
Cannot access paywalled content beyond available excerpts
Does not provide real-time breaking news alerts
Cannot verify claims in news articles independently

use_cases.title: Track Research Papers
use_cases.description: Stay updated on the latest academic AI papers, breakthroughs, and research publications from arXiv and company blogs

use_cases.title: Monitor AI Industry
use_cases.description: Follow funding rounds, product launches, company updates, and market trends from leading AI companies

use_cases.title: Daily AI Briefing
use_cases.description: Get a quick, organized summary of the most important AI news each day without searching multiple sources

prompt_templates.title: Daily Briefing
prompt_templates.prompt: Give me today's AI news or latest AI developments. I want a comprehensive briefing with news from the last 24 hours.

prompt_templates.title: Research Focus
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the latest AI research papers and academic breakthroughs from the past week. Focus on significant findings and new techniques.

prompt_templates.title: Industry Updates
prompt_templates.prompt: What AI company news happened recently? Include funding announcements, partnerships, and major product updates from OpenAI, Google, Anthropic, and other leading companies.

prompt_templates.title: Deep Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Give me a deep analysis of the most important AI news today. Include expert reactions, market implications, and emerging trends I should watch.

best_practices: Use date filters consistently to ensure content freshness and avoid outdated news
Mix sources from different categories to get balanced coverage of industry and research
Offer users customization options for depth, focus areas, and format preferences
anti_patterns: Including duplicate stories from the same announcement across multiple sources
Presenting news without checking publication dates or source credibility
Using only one source type which limits perspective and may miss important stories

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It uses web search and web reader tools available in each platform.

faq.question: How recent is the news coverage?
faq.answer: The skill focuses on news from the last 24-48 hours by default. You can customize the time range for weekly or monthly summaries.

faq.question: Can I combine this with other skills?
faq.answer: Yes. Use this skill to gather news, then ask another skill to help write code, analyze data, or create content based on what you learned.

faq.question: Is my data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. The skill uses your AI tool's web search and web reader tools. No personal data is collected or stored by this skill.

faq.question: Why are some links broken or content missing?
faq.answer: The skill cannot access paywalled content. If a source blocks access, it uses available excerpts and notes the limitation.

faq.question: How is this different from a general news skill?
faq.answer: This skill focuses specifically on AI news with curated sources, category organization, and templates designed for technical and research content.
